page.title: 08AGRICULTURE NEAR PRESTWOLD
page.content: { Farming. {} Modern farming methods used locally, particularly on the Prestwold Estate have changed the appearance and size of fields. Original ditches have been replaced by large underground pipes; improving the drainage. Certain hedges and trees have been removed increasing the acreage of the fields, enabling the efficient use of aerial crop spraying. Also the unfortunate death of the elms affected by Dutch Elm Disease has also changed the appearance of the land. Herbicides have reduced the number of wild flowers in the arable fields; poppies, corn chamomile and wild oats are now controlled.
